cmCourseInfo.description: Today’s ‘contract economy’ means full-time staff jobs are rare. Students will dissect models of distribution and engagement, discussing trends, predictions and future opportunities in media inside and outside the traditional newsroom. This course is taught at Centennial College and is open only to students in the Specialist (Joint) program in Journalism.
cmCourseInfo.title: Business of Journalism
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: 14.5 credits, including: [JOUB05H3 and JOUB19H3 and JOUC18H3 and JOUC19H3 and JOUC20H3] and [(JOUB09H3) or JOUB20H3]; students must have a minimum CGPA of 2.0

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Enrolment Indicator: R

Restricted to students in the following groups:
SCSPEJOU - Specialist (Joint) Program in Journalism this course is taught at Centennial

Centennial College Joint Program Courses will be automatically enrolled by the Joint Program Co-coordinator.

If you have questions or concerns please contact Sayilaja Kalaimohan: SKalaimohan@centennialcollege.ca

cmCourseInfo.description: Working in groups under faculty supervision from the newsroom, students will create, present and share significant portfolio pieces of multiplatform content, demonstrating expertise in credible, verifiable storytelling for discerning audiences. This course is taught at Centennial College and is open only to students in the Specialist (Joint) program in Journalism.
cmCourseInfo.title: Entrepreneurial Reporting
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: 14.5 credits, including: [JOUB05H3 and JOUC18H3 and JOUC19H3 and JOUC20H3] and [(JOUB09H3) or JOUB20H3]; students must have a minimum CGPA of 2.0

cmCourseInfo.description: In Field Placement, students use theoretical knowledge and applied skills in professional journalistic environments. Through individual work and as team members, students create editorial content on various platforms and undertake academic research and writing assignments that require them to reflect upon issues arising from their work placement experience. This course is taught at Centennial College and is open only to students in the Specialist (Joint) program in Journalism.
cmCourseInfo.title: Field Placement
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Students must be in good standing and have successfully completed groups 1, 2, and be completing group 3 of the Centennial College phase of the Specialist (Joint) program in Journalism.
cmCourseInfo.note: This course will be graded as a CR if a student successfully completes their internship; and as NCR is the internship was unsuccessful. The NCR will impact the CGPA and count as a 0.0 CGPA value on a transcript.
